intro: Phlegmariurus perrerianus, commonly known as the red-stemmed clubmoss, is a species of lycophyte belonging to the family Lycopodiales. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems that are often reddish in color, especially when young. The plant produces small, spore-bearing structures called strobili at the tips of its branches. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. Phlegmariurus perrerianus is an ancient lineage of plants, with a fossil record dating back millions of years.
